A **potion of acid** is a type of [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

## Generation

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may be given a potion of acid as any of the three random potions in their starting inventory.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Potions of acid make up 1⁄100 (1%) of all randomly-generated potions. General [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and liquor emporiums can sell potions of acid.

[Mixing](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy") a set of potions without a recipe may produce a potion of acid.

[Monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") may generate with a potion of acid as an [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item").

[Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [horn of plenty](/wiki/Horn_of_plenty "Horn of plenty") has a 3⁄1000 chance (0.3%) of generating 1-2 potions of acid.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Description

The potion of acid has various effects depending on how it is used.

### Quaffing

[Quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a potion of acid without [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") abuses [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution"), cures [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning") and deals damage to the [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") depending on the potion's [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude"): the potion causes 1d4 points of damage if blessed, 1d8 points of damage if uncursed, and 2d8 points of damage if cursed.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) Quaffing the potion while the hero has acid resistance will have no effect.

After quaffing the potion, the player is prompted to type-[name](/wiki/Name "Name") the potion if it is not already named.

### Throwing and wielding

Hitting a monster with a [wielded](/wiki/Wield "Wield") or [thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown") potion deals the same amount of damage to them as quaffing based on beatitude: 1d4 points of damage if blessed, 1d8 points of damage if uncursed, and 2d8 points of damage if cursed, with no effect on a target that has acid resistance.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) Monsters will throw this potion at the hero with the same effects, abusing constitution. A monster hit with acid will shriek in pain if they can vocalize, waking nearby monsters that are [asleep](/wiki/Asleep "Asleep").

The player will be prompted to type-name the potion in all of these cases if the potion is not already named and the hero is not [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind").

### Vapors

Inhaling the [vapors](/wiki/Vapors "Vapors") from a shattered potion of acid abuses constitution, but has no other effect.

### Dipping

[Dipping](/wiki/Dipping "Dipping") items into a potion of acid that are vulnerable to [corrosion](/wiki/Corrosion "Corrosion") (such as [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") or [copper](/wiki/Copper "Copper")) will corrode those items, and dipping a [greased](/wiki/Greased "Greased") item of any type will cause the grease to wear off. Both these cases use up the potion and prompt the player to type-name it if the potion is not already named.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) Dipping a [lichen](/wiki/Lichen "Lichen") corpse into a potion of acid will print a unique message without consuming either object and prompt the player to type-name the potion.[\[9\]](#cite_note-9)

### Acid and water

Acid boils on contact with [water](/wiki/Water "Water") of any kind: dipping any potions of acid into a [pool](/wiki/Pool "Pool") or [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"), or else walking into deeper water with a potion of acid in the open inventory, will cause them to explode and deal d10 damage for each potion.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10) Acid inside containers such as [sacks](/wiki/Sack "Sack"), a [bag of holding](/wiki/Bag_of_holding "Bag of holding") or a cursed [oilskin sack](/wiki/Oilskin_sack "Oilskin sack") will explode if water gets inside them, though the hero will not take damage from this. A potion of acid can not be [diluted](/wiki/Diluted "Diluted") normally as a result of the above, though it is possible for diluted acid to occur, usually as the result of random [alchemy](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy"). Dipping acid into any other potion will also cause the mixture to explode.[\[11\]](#cite_note-11)

[Canceling](/wiki/Canceling "Canceling") acid will turn it into a [potion of water](/wiki/Potion_of_water "Potion of water").

### Iron bars

[Iron bars](/wiki/Iron_bars "Iron bars") can be dissolved with a wielded or thrown potion of acid, unless they are on a level that is [undiggable](/wiki/Undiggable "Undiggable").

## Strategy

Though several monsters lack acid resistance, the potion of acid is generally too rare to be of frequent use as a weapon against them even in the early game, and there are various means of working around iron bars that are not on undiggable levels. Overall, acid that is not used to gain a bit of extra damage in encounters is usually kept to cancel and turn into water.

The potion is more often relevant as a stoning cure: though it is [fragile](/wiki/Fragile "Fragile"), damaging and weighs twice as much as the standard [lizard](/wiki/Lizard "Lizard") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") while being more rare, it does not break any [conducts](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"), making it an option for characters maintaining [vegan](/wiki/Vegan "Vegan") or [vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") diets. Even then, unless they are unburdened and can guarantee access to a potion stashed in a waterproofed [bag](/wiki/Bag "Bag") in time, it may be preferable to break the conduct and eat a lizard corpse instead. [Milky potions](/wiki/Milky_potion "Milky potion") of acid are unsafe to use as a stoning cure, as a [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") generating from the potion will [paralyze](/wiki/Paralyze "Paralyze") the hero long enough to [fully render them a statue](/wiki/YASD "YASD"). [Smoky potions](/wiki/Smoky_potion "Smoky potion") of acid are only safe to use on the first turn of stoning: even a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") from a [djinni](/wiki/Djinni "Djinni") won't save a hero if their limbs are already stiffening.

Though smoky acid allows a horn of plenty to be used with [the Platinum Yendorian Express Card](/wiki/The_Platinum_Yendorian_Express_Card "The Platinum Yendorian Express Card") for a slow wish engine, the potion of acid is the second-rarest output after the [potion of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness").

### Identification

Dipping a lichen corpse is the most reliable way of informally identifying a suspected potion of acid, and does not use up the potion.

If a monster hit by a potion "shrieks" or "writhes in pain", that potion is a potion of acid, and the player is prompted to type-name it if the hero was not blind at the time. While [holy water](/wiki/Holy_water "Holy water") can give the same message as acid in some circumstances (e.g. quaffing holy water as a [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic") character), monsters will not throw them.

## History

The potion of acid first appears in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and some earlier versions, including some [variants](/wiki/Variant "Variant") based on these versions, the potion of acid is subject to [several bugs](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3") that are fixed in later versions and most variants, including a pair of bugs that semi-reliably crash the game:

- If a monster carrying acid is crushed with a [drawbridge](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge"), or a [force bolt](/wiki/Force_bolt "Force bolt") or zapped [wand of striking](/wiki/Wand_of_striking "Wand of striking") blows up the drawbridge underneath it, the game may [panic](/wiki/Panic "Panic"). This is [bug C343-179](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3#C343-179 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3").
- Throwing a potion of acid into water or at iron bars will reliably crash the game. This is [bug C343-394](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3#C343-394 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3").

The ability to melt iron bars with acid and identify acid using lichens is introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Acid](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid "wikipedia:Acid")***

An acid refers to any substance with a [pH](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/pH "wikipedia:pH") below 7 that can donate hydrogen ions (generally in the form of protons) to other substances. Various acids can have different strengths, and possess several different properties depending on their molecular structure. The following are among the most common acidic properties, which are reflected in *NetHack*:

- Tasting sour when eaten
- Stinging or burning on contact with skin
- Corroding metals and skin
- Turning blue [litmus](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Litmus "wikipedia:Litmus") paper red
- Turning red or orange on a [universal indicator](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_indicator "wikipedia:Universal indicator")

Both the litmus paper and universal indicator tests are the basis for the effect of dipping a lichen corpse into a potion of acid: Litmus is a dye extracted from various species of lichen, particularly *[Roccella tinctoria](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roccella_tinctoria "wikipedia:Roccella tinctoria")*, while a universal indicator solution also changes color to red to indicate strong acids (pH of less than 3), and orange or even yellow for weaker acids (pH of 3-6).

## Messages

- This burns a lot!

  You quaffed or were hit by a cursed potion of acid.

- This burns \<like acid>!

  You quaffed or were hit by a uncursed potion of acid.

- This burns a little!

  You quaffed or were hit by a blessed potion of acid.

- This tastes \<tangy/sour>.

  You quaffed any potion of acid while you have acid resistance; the former occurs if [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating").

- \<foo> \<withers/shrieks> in pain!

  A monster was hit by a potion of acid; the monster "withers" if it cannot vocalize.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), valuable gems can be dipped into potion of acid to make new potions via [gem alchemy](/wiki/Gem_alchemy "Gem alchemy").

A cursed potion of acid can be found within the Chamber of Junk in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest").

### ZAPM

In [ZAPM](/wiki/ZAPM "ZAPM"), the equivalent to the potion of acid is the canister of universal solvent.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), potions of acid dissolve iron bars when they hit them.[\[12\]](#cite_note-12) Dipping a lichen corpse into a potion of acid will identify it.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the potion of acid has additional messages when thrown or when wielded and smashed, and will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") itself when it hits the hero or a monster.

The cell by the [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") in [Goblin Town](/wiki/Goblin_Town "Goblin Town") has a 1⁄2 chance of containing a potion of acid. On the last level of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm"), the lower-right [crystal chest](/wiki/Crystal_chest "Crystal chest") in the central room of the castle has 3 potions of acid.

The potion of acid is made more useful for burning through iron bars, and unlike force bolts from a spell or a wand of striking they will not affect peaceful monsters on the other side of a set of bars; EvilHack makes avoiding alignment abuse much more important compared to *NetHack*, especially if the hero has not yet finished their [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest"). This makes using acid to melt bars the safest method for gaining access to the [trap door](/wiki/Trap_door "Trap door") that leads into [Gollum](/wiki/Gollum "Gollum")'s dwelling in [Goblin Town](/wiki/Goblin_Town "Goblin Town"), as well as for freeing the [pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus_\(EvilHack\) "Pegasus (EvilHack)") and gaining access to the [Bag of the Hesperides](/wiki/Bag_of_the_Hesperides "Bag of the Hesperides") after defeating [Kathryn the Ice Queen](/wiki/Kathryn_the_Ice_Queen "Kathryn the Ice Queen").

rawPage: {{languages}} {{potion |name=acid |cost=250 |muse=off }} {{tocright}} A '''potion of acid''' is a type of [[potion]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. ==Generation== [[Wizard]]s may be given a potion of acid as any of the three random potions in their starting inventory.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|166|nethack=3.6.7}} Potions of acid make up {{frac|100}} (1%) of all randomly-generated potions. General [[store]]s and liquor emporiums can sell potions of acid. [[Alchemy|Mixing]] a set of potions without a recipe may produce a potion of acid. [[Monster]]s may generate with a potion of acid as an [[offensive item]]. [[Apply]]ing a [[horn of plenty]] has a {{frac|3|1000}} chance (0.3%) of generating 1-2 potions of acid.{{refsrc|src/mkobj.c|2212|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=The code chooses a random potion, discarding magical potions; rnd_class(POT_BOOZE, POT_WATER) chooses the non-magical potions.{{refsrc|src/objects.c|813|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}}} ==Description== The potion of acid has various effects depending on how it is used. ===Quaffing=== [[Quaff]]ing a potion of acid without [[acid resistance]] abuses [[constitution]], cures [[stoning]] and deals damage to the [[hero]] depending on the potion's [[beatitude]]: the potion causes 1d4 points of damage if blessed, 1d8 points of damage if uncursed, and 2d8 points of damage if cursed.{{refsrc|src/potion.c|1131|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/potion.c|1763|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Quaffing the potion while the hero has acid resistance will have no effect. After quaffing the potion, the player is prompted to type-[[name]] the potion if it is not already named. ===Throwing and wielding=== Hitting a monster with a [[wield]]ed or [[thrown]] potion deals the same amount of damage to them as quaffing based on beatitude: 1d4 points of damage if blessed, 1d8 points of damage if uncursed, and 2d8 points of damage if cursed, with no effect on a target that has acid resistance.{{refsrc|src/potion.c|1383|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/potion.c|1550|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Monsters will throw this potion at the hero with the same effects, abusing constitution. A monster hit with acid will shriek in pain if they can vocalize, waking nearby monsters that are [[asleep]]. The player will be prompted to type-name the potion in all of these cases if the potion is not already named and the hero is not [[blind]]. ===Vapors=== Inhaling the [[vapors]] from a shattered potion of acid abuses constitution, but has no other effect. ===Dipping=== [[Dipping]] items into a potion of acid that are vulnerable to [[corrosion]] (such as [[iron]] or [[copper]]) will corrode those items, and dipping a [[greased]] item of any type will cause the grease to wear off. Both these cases use up the potion and prompt the player to type-name it if the potion is not already named.{{refsrc|src/potion.c|2134|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Dipping a [[lichen]] corpse into a potion of acid will print a unique message without consuming either object and prompt the player to type-name the potion.{{refsrc|src/potion.c|2094|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} ===Acid and water=== Acid boils on contact with [[water]] of any kind: dipping any potions of acid into a [[pool]] or [[fountain]], or else walking into deeper water with a potion of acid in the open inventory, will cause them to explode and deal d10 damage for each potion.{{refsrc|src/potion.c|1935|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Acid inside containers such as [[sack]]s, a [[bag of holding]] or a cursed [[oilskin sack]] will explode if water gets inside them, though the hero will not take damage from this. A potion of acid can not be [[diluted]] normally as a result of the above, though it is possible for diluted acid to occur, usually as the result of random [[alchemy]]. Dipping acid into any other potion will also cause the mixture to explode.{{refsrc|src/potion.c|2027|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} [[Canceling]] acid will turn it into a [[potion of water]]. ===Iron bars=== [[Iron bars]] can be dissolved with a wielded or thrown potion of acid, unless they are on a level that is [[undiggable]]. ==Strategy== Though several monsters lack acid resistance, the potion of acid is generally too rare to be of frequent use as a weapon against them even in the early game, and there are various means of working around iron bars that are not on undiggable levels. Overall, acid that is not used to gain a bit of extra damage in encounters is usually kept to cancel and turn into water. The potion is more often relevant as a stoning cure: though it is [[fragile]], damaging and weighs twice as much as the standard [[lizard]] [[corpse]] while being more rare, it does not break any [[conduct]]s, making it an option for characters maintaining [[vegan]] or [[vegetarian]] diets. Even then, unless they are unburdened and can guarantee access to a potion stashed in a waterproofed [[bag]] in time, it may be preferable to break the conduct and eat a lizard corpse instead. [[Milky potion]]s of acid are unsafe to use as a stoning cure, as a [[ghost]] generating from the potion will [[paralyze]] the hero long enough to [[YASD|fully render them a statue]]. [[Smoky potion]]s of acid are only safe to use on the first turn of stoning: even a [[wish]] from a [[djinni]] won't save a hero if their limbs are already stiffening. Though smoky acid allows a horn of plenty to be used with [[the Platinum Yendorian Express Card]] for a slow wish engine, the potion of acid is the second-rarest output after the [[potion of sickness]]. ===Identification=== Dipping a lichen corpse is the most reliable way of informally identifying a suspected potion of acid, and does not use up the potion. If a monster hit by a potion "shrieks" or "writhes in pain", that potion is a potion of acid, and the player is prompted to type-name it if the hero was not blind at the time. While [[holy water]] can give the same message as acid in some circumstances (e.g. quaffing holy water as a [[chaotic]] character), monsters will not throw them. ==History== The potion of acid first appears in [[NetHack 3.3.0]]. In [[NetHack 3.4.3]] and some earlier versions, including some [[variant]]s based on these versions, the potion of acid is subject to [[Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3|several bugs]] that are fixed in later versions and most variants, including a pair of bugs that semi-reliably crash the game: * If a monster carrying acid is crushed with a [[drawbridge]], or a [[force bolt]] or zapped [[wand of striking]] blows up the drawbridge underneath it, the game may [[panic]]. This is [[Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3#C343-179|bug C343-179]]. * Throwing a potion of acid into water or at iron bars will reliably crash the game. This is [[Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3#C343-394|bug C343-394]]. The ability to melt iron bars with acid and identify acid using lichens is introduced in [[NetHack 3.6.0]]. ==Origin== {{wikipedia|Acid}} An acid refers to any substance with a [[Wikipedia:pH|pH]] below 7 that can donate hydrogen ions (generally in the form of protons) to other substances. Various acids can have different strengths, and possess several different properties depending on their molecular structure. The following are among the most common acidic properties, which are reflected in ''NetHack'': * Tasting sour when eaten * Stinging or burning on contact with skin * Corroding metals and skin * Turning blue [[Wikipedia:Litmus|litmus]] paper red * Turning red or orange on a [[Wikipedia:Universal indicator|universal indicator]] Both the litmus paper and universal indicator tests are the basis for the effect of dipping a lichen corpse into a potion of acid: Litmus is a dye extracted from various species of lichen, particularly ''[[Wikipedia:Roccella tinctoria|Roccella tinctoria]]'', while a universal indicator solution also changes color to red to indicate strong acids (pH of less than 3), and orange or even yellow for weaker acids (pH of 3-6). ==Messages== {{message|This burns a lot!|You quaffed or were hit by a cursed potion of acid.}} {{message|This burns !|You quaffed or were hit by a uncursed potion of acid.}} {{message|This burns a little!|You quaffed or were hit by a blessed potion of acid.}} {{message|This tastes .|You quaffed any potion of acid while you have acid resistance; the former occurs if [[hallucinating]].}} {{message| in pain!|A monster was hit by a potion of acid; the monster "withers" if it cannot vocalize.}} ==Variants== ===SLASH'EM=== In [[SLASH'EM]], valuable gems can be dipped into potion of acid to make new potions via [[gem alchemy]]. A cursed potion of acid can be found within the Chamber of Junk in the [[Lawful Quest]]. ===ZAPM=== In [[ZAPM]], the equivalent to the potion of acid is the canister of universal solvent. ===UnNetHack=== In [[UnNetHack]], potions of acid dissolve iron bars when they hit them.{{refsrc|src/mthrowu.c|856|unnethack=1499}} Dipping a lichen corpse into a potion of acid will identify it. ===EvilHack=== In [[EvilHack]], the potion of acid has additional messages when thrown or when wielded and smashed, and will [[auto-identify]] itself when it hits the hero or a monster. The cell by the [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] in [[Goblin Town]] has a {{frac|2}} chance of containing a potion of acid. On the last level of the [[Ice Queen's Realm]], the lower-right [[crystal chest]] in the central room of the castle has 3 potions of acid. The potion of acid is made more useful for burning through iron bars, and unlike force bolts from a spell or a wand of striking they will not affect peaceful monsters on the other side of a set of bars; EvilHack makes avoiding alignment abuse much more important compared to ''NetHack'', especially if the hero has not yet finished their [[quest]]. This makes using acid to melt bars the safest method for gaining access to the [[trap door]] that leads into [[Gollum]]'s dwelling in [[Goblin Town]], as well as for freeing the [[Pegasus (EvilHack)|pegasus]] and gaining access to the [[Bag of the Hesperides]] after defeating [[Kathryn the Ice Queen]]. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Potions|Acid]]
